learning.supervised.methods.knn

Class NWKNN

  • java.lang.Object
    • learning.supervised.Classifier
      • learning.supervised.methods.knn.NWKNN
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Citable, java.io.Serializable, ValidateableInterface, DistMatrixUserInterface, DistToPointsQueryUserInterface, NeighborPointsQueryUserInterface

    public class NWKNN
extends Classifier
implements DistMatrixUserInterface, DistToPointsQueryUserInterface, NeighborPointsQueryUserInterface, java.io.Serializable
    Implements the algorithm described in Neighbor-weighted K-nearest neighbor for unbalanced text corpus by Songbo Tan in Expert Systems with Applications 28 (2005) 667â€“671. A weighting factor is included in the voting procedure to compensate for class imbalance.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setDistMatrix

        public void setDistMatrix(float[][] distMatrix)
        Description copied from interface: DistMatrixUserInterface
        Distance matrix setter.
        Specified by:
        setDistMatrix in interface DistMatrixUserInterface
        Parameters:
        distMatrix - float[][] representing the upper triangular distance matrix. Each row i contains only entries for j > i, due to distances being symmetric. For compression, the zeroed lower triangular entries are not stored, so each row i contains (size - i - 1) elements. The entry in distMatrix[i][j] corresponds to the distance between data points i and i + j + 1.

      • getDistMatrix

        public float[][] getDistMatrix()
        Description copied from interface: DistMatrixUserInterface
        Distance matrix getter.
        Specified by:
        getDistMatrix in interface DistMatrixUserInterface
        Returns:
        float[][] representing the upper triangular distance matrix. Each row i contains only entries for j > i, due to distances being symmetric. For compression, the zeroed lower triangular entries are not stored, so each row i contains (size - i - 1) elements. The entry in distMatrix[i][j] corresponds to the distance between data points i and i + j + 1.

           int[] trNeighbors)

        Description copied from interface: NeighborPointsQueryUserInterface
        This method performs classification of the target data point, based on its nearest neighbors and the distances to all the training points, given for reference.
        Specified by:
        classify in interface NeighborPointsQueryUserInterface
        Parameters:
        instance - DataInstance object that is to be classified.
        distToTraining - float[] representing distances to all training points.
        trNeighbors - int[] representing the indexes of the k-nearest neighbors among the training data.
        Returns:
        Integer that is the classification outcome, the prediction of the class label.

        Description copied from interface: NeighborPointsQueryUserInterface
        This method performs classification of the target data point, based on its nearest neighbors and the distances to all the training points, given for reference.
        Specified by:
        classifyProbabilistically in interface NeighborPointsQueryUserInterface
        Parameters:

        trNeighbors - int[] representing the indexes of the k-nearest neighbors among the training data.
